DataElement.preferredName: Diagnosis Performed Observation Outcome Diseases and Disorders Status Code OMOP CDM Disease Status Concept Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia):A condition or state at a particular time.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data._A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for the Disease Status of specimen collection.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Executed and carried through to completion.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia):A condition or state at a particular time.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A condition or state at a particular time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMOP CDM Disease Status Concept Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A foreign key to a Standard Concept identifier for the Disease Status of specimen collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model

DataElement.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model
DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and OMOP value set for CDM.
